attributes.action: End the PrePay RipOff. Prepay fuel bills cost £226 a year more than direct debit
attributes.background: According to the Citizens Advice Bureau prepayment meter consumers pay £226 a year more than those who use direct debit, yet these consumers are often the poorest in our society.
attributes.additional_details:
We call on the government to require energy companies to:
1. Cut the cost of prepayment meters in line with the cheapest direct debit fuel tariffs saving consumers £226 a year
2. End debt collection by energy companies during the winter (as Scottish Energy have done)
3. Ensure homes with pensioners, disabled people and children don't have prepayment meters fitted 
4. Stop installation of prepayment meters during the winter 
5. Protect prepayment customers from disconnection as smart meters are introduced across the UK by 2020.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for a fathers name to be put on a birth certificate.
attributes.background: Make it compulsory for a fathers name to be put on a birth certificate.
attributes.additional_details:
Feeling half a person is an understatement, this feeling never leaves you, from puberty to adulthood.
The Child's right to know should take priority over the mothers right to withhold, after all the child had no say in whether it wanted to be born. Women I feel, do not realise how very cruel withholding this information can be and I should know I have to live with this torment day in and day out.
I know Human rights are banded about these days, but I really do feel my Human rights have been trampled on.
A Father has a responsibility to support a child so his name should be on a birth certificate and in the case of a rape, this information should be available to the child at the age of 18.
Please government do the right thing and legislate!

attributes.action: Allow MOD personnel to cook meals within SLA using issued or personal appliances
attributes.background: Safety regulations have resulted in the banning of any cooking appliances other than microwave and toaster within SLA. This makes PAYD the only option on camps for eating a hot meal, allowing for monopoly by contractors. Personnel should be allowed the option of cooking their own meals if they wish.

attributes.action: DWP: decision to extend the waiting time for Mortgage payment to 39 weeks!
attributes.background:
If you get laid off / paid off / made redundant and have a mortgage – you have to wait 39 Weeks before the DWP will make any payment to your lender? 
This is a disgrace – It used to be 13 Weeks wait before April of this year, which was bad enough, but now 9 Months – how are people meant to survive?
attributes.additional_details:
What are the government thinking abouts? 
Do they want to make people homeless? They would then be responsible for housing them.
There is a severe lack of social housing – and this will just add to the crisis. Social housing will cost 3-4 times the amount of the mortgage!

SMI: Support for Mortgage Interest 
https://www.gov.uk/support-for-mortgage-interest/what-youll-get

attributes.action: Abellio Greater Anglia should compensate for delays longer than 15 minutes
attributes.background:
The lines operated by Abellio Greater Anglia are frequently subject to delays, causing severe disruption. 

The delay repay scheme should be amended to refund for delays greater than 15 minutes, instead of the current 30 minute threshold.
attributes.additional_details: The train operator c2c offer pro-rata compensation on delays over 2 minutes.

attributes.action: Stop paying non uk citizens any benifits
attributes.background: If we stop paying benifits. Some migrants will leave of there own accord. Some might stop trying to come to the UK

attributes.action: Ban the use of Poultry Manure being spread on fields for agricultural use.
attributes.background: Over the past several years Poultry Manure has been introduced rather than Cow manure on agricultural land. If the wind is blowing just slightly, then you can't go outside the house without the nauseating and gut-wrenching smell that comes off the Manure.

attributes.action: Give English voters a say in the event of a 2nd Scottish Independence referendum
attributes.background: Nicola Sturgeon is calling for a new Referendum on Scottish Independence. In the event such a referendum is granted, we demand that a vote is given to all English voters to give us a choice on whether or not we want to keep Scotland, and move our military contracts South of the Border to England!
attributes.additional_details: http://www.msn.com/en-gb/news/uknews/nicola-sturgeon-launches-second-scottish-independence-referendum-drive-after-brexit-vote/ar-AAioSmM?li=BBoPWjQ

attributes.action: Reduce the Foreign Aid budget and use the monies to fund Social Housing
attributes.background: Reduce the Foreign Aid Budget and use the monies to fund a Social Housing scheme to ensure all UK Veterans and homeless families have somewhere safe to live.  Any monies left can also fund Social Housing for the rest of the Country and then use the rents raised towards upkeep.

attributes.action: Increased protection for beneficiaries under Mirror Wills following first death.
attributes.background: My father and stepmother prepared Mirror Wills whereby the estate first passed to the surviving spouse and then to my stepbrother and myself in equal shares.  After my father died my stepmother changed her Will and left everything to her own family.  I lost my family inheritance of approx £150,000
attributes.additional_details:
I would like the following changes. (1)  A  formal warning to be included in all Mirror Wills that your final wishes may not be respected should you die first.  (2) A new legal requirement than any beneficiary under a Mirror Will  subsequently disinherited must receive formal written notice for it to have effect.
My story has been featured in the National Press, television and radio and is included in the current  television series of the BBC production "Rip Off Britain"

attributes.action: Reduce the full time working week to 35 hours, without lowering current salary.
attributes.background:
The UK Government needs to tackle the long-hours culture & promote a restructuring of working time (max 35 hours per week) and the way in which people work such as flexible working.

People who work more than 48 hours per week report more problems in terms of work & health than those who do not.
attributes.additional_details:
According to the 2011 Workplace Employment Relations Study (WERS), 41% of employees agreed or strongly agreed with the statement: ‘People in this workplace who want to progress usually have to put in long hours.’ 

According to the Fifth European Working Conditions Survey, people who work more than 48 hours per week report more problems in terms of work and health than those who do not.

attributes.action: Take action to break the siege in Aleppo and enforce a no bombing zone.
attributes.background: Send a message to the people of Aleppo to say that we are listening and we are taking action. We will apply pressure on our government to do more.
attributes.additional_details:
Dr. Hatem, Director of the Aleppo Children’s Hospital run by the Independent Doctor’s Association (IDA): 
"We need the international community. And that means pressure from you. Tell your government, tell the UN, tell every international institution that the world can still break the siege and stop the bombs. Please, save us. Save Aleppo."

attributes.action: Get British troops out of Iraq and Syria and stop all air strikes now
attributes.background: The presence of British troops in Syria and Iraq and the bombing and killing of innocent people including children is beyond wrong this war that's already been shown to be fake, no weapons of mass destruction were ever found so why does it carry on?!
attributes.additional_details: The fight to have Tony Blair held accountable for his actions over the war in Iraq speaks for itself and you only need to watch the news and see poor babies and children being pulled from rubble that was once their local hospital, library, school or home. So many leave their homes and don't ever return it's so wrong and we shouldn't stand by and let it happen any longer, the world will be one by peace love and cooperation not hate fighting and war. We can stop it together

attributes.action: Increase the restriction speed for 50cc mopeds to 60mph
attributes.background: I use 60mph roads on a regular basis. I have found that other road users grow impatient of trailing behind me at 30mph and many find that it's a good idea to pass at dangerous points of which could easily result in a threat on my life as some cars overtake and narrowly avoid a head on crash
attributes.additional_details: I have been riding my 50cc motorbike for a few months now and I have to use 60mph/40mph roads on a regular basis on my way to school. I have found that other road users in larger vehicles grow impatient of trailing behind me at 30mph and many find that it's a good idea to pass on corners and/or dangerously close to me. There have also been some that risk a head on crash in an attempt to pass. A faster speed in my eyes would eliminate the threat that other road users oppose to slower mopeds.

attributes.action: National vote to Legalise right to die
attributes.background:
Let there be a nationwide referendum to vote for the right to die,
In extreme circumstances A person should have the right to choose to legally and safely end their life

attributes.action: Have a referendum on health and social welfare funding for the next generation.
attributes.background: Health and social welfare funding is a subject very dear to voters but one whose effects run longer than the lives of any Parliament, or the careers of many Civil Servants or politicians.  Whether the UK has a US or Scandinavian model for health and social provision should be subject to plebiscite.
attributes.additional_details: I am a hospital consultant and fellow of the Royal College of Physicians, and feel that this is one of the bigger issues of relevance to people currently, and one which is not adequately exposed or debated within the short lives of Parliaments.

attributes.action: Media exploits individuals in reality shows etc we need a law to protect people
attributes.background: Media exploits individuals in reality shows etc we need a law to protect people. The law must prevent any waiver of liability and subject media companies to strict liability conditions. A special type of warrant must should be available and the ability to subpoena witnesses for the defence.
attributes.additional_details:
Media exploits individuals in reality shows we need a law to protect people, this includes Shilpa Shetty who was subjected to racist abuse on Big Brother, Patrick Dauncey fell from a cliff in The Island, Jacintha Saldanha committed suicide after a telephone prank & Ajwinder Bains in his Truman Show rip-off

All these people have suffered horrific manipulation and it gets worse each year. It is time for Parliament to act, to deal with this increasing problem. There should be high punitive damages

attributes.action: Changes to the Dangerous Dogs Act 1991.
attributes.background: Many dogs that are confiscated are done so because they look dangerous or because of their breed specification; Pit Bull Terrier, Staffordshire Bull Terrier, I believe that they should only be destroyed if they commit an act that deems them dangerous (full on attack on a child or vulnerable person)
attributes.additional_details: What I believe should happen is that when a dog commits a crime such as attacking a child they are to be put on a 2 stage warning system, the dog is then taken for an behaviour assessment and the owners property is assessed for welfare standards. If the dog then commits the act again more serious action can be taken to change the behaviour such as rehousing the dog to a different family to see if the dog with change then if this option has failed then the dog can be destroyed.

attributes.action: Ban cold calling by businesses to mobile and home phones
attributes.background: Cold calling has always been a problem but recently it is becoming a real nusense with companies ringing personal mobile/home phones at all times of day and night sometimes multiple times within a day to either sell products, force PPI claims or tell you you've been in an accident when you haven't.
attributes.additional_details:
Companies should not be able to obtain and call your personal phone often with wrong or assumptive information and of a repetitive nature, with some companies calling multiple times in the same week despite being told you are not interested which is harassment and against human rights.

I am petitioning to ban cold calling from businesses to home and mobile phones as to protect people from being harassed in their personal time as it can be very distressing in particular for vulnerable citizens.

attributes.action: Introduce independent life skills In schools
attributes.background: We are a campaign called Lessons4Life, we are raising awareness that young people aren't being taught in school how to deal with real life situations (such as changing a fuse) We need your help to make a change !
attributes.additional_details: We carried out a survey which revealed that 93% of participants did not understand what a mortgage was. One survey participant stated ‘We aren’t taught these skills at all. I am about to go into year 10 and I have no clue how to pay tax or mortgage.’ This supports our campaign proposal and highlights that this issue needs to be made aware and eventually resolved.

attributes.action: Increase the penalty for those involved in the puppy farm trade.
attributes.background: Puppy farming is one of the largest contributors of animal cruelty within Britain. No animal should have to go through the distress and abusive conditions that happen within this barbaric industry. Those who take part in this trade should suffer a heavy penalty for this act of cruelty.

attributes.action: Call for a Ban on the Industrial Manufacture of Honey in the UK
attributes.background:
Current methods cause massive unnecessary slaughter of Bees. Bees are vital to our survival and to maintaining our delicate eco systems
Unnatural methods used by industrial beekeepers, such as A.I, antibiotics, clipping a Queen Bee's wings are wholly unacceptable
All to satisfy corporate greed
attributes.additional_details: https://www.facebook.com/GreenWorldTVUK/videos/1623198151304386/?__mref=message

attributes.action: Commence an urgent review of the Child Maintenance Service Policies/Procedures.
attributes.background: The service levels offered by the Child Maintenance Service are exceptionally poor, staff are unhelpful and do not carry out instructions within reasonable timescales.  Also, the use of Gross Income in the calculations is unfair and takes no account of paying parents financial circumstances.
attributes.additional_details: I have suffered from numerous issues created by this agency and am being financially disadvantaged by them and I am sure I am not alone.  Whilst the majority of paying parents have no issue paying maintenance, it is unfair and unjust that payments do not take into account the financial circumstances of either the paying or the receiving parent.

attributes.action: Improved education on Keeping Britain Tidy and stricter penalties for litterers
attributes.background: Our hedgerows, dykes, residential areas, countryside, roadsides, beaches and rivers, to name some, are strewn with litter and an absolute disgrace to our nation. Sadly some members of society have no shame in dropping their rubbish, thus believing it to be another's responsibility to clean up.

attributes.action: Arm all police officers with firearms, to deter and limit impact of terrorism.
attributes.background: The ability to rapidly deal with armed terrorists cannot be met by specialist units alone. Having a rapid, local, armed response is crucial to limiting the damage terrorists can do. This can only be achieved by arming all police officers.

attributes.action: Limit the cost of mandatory insurance policies, i.e. motor insurance.
attributes.background: It is immoral to charge people inflated premiums when it is the law to ensure you have the insurance in place.
attributes.additional_details: Insurance companies use statistics to seperate and ultimately increase charges applied to different parts of the population. More specifically it should be illegal to increase the motor insurance of someone for having an accident which wasn't their fault. If your no claims bonus had increased your premium must drop.

attributes.action: Debate the sale of ARM Holdings to Softbank
attributes.background: ARM Holdings is a British success story, they design chip architecture for a vast proportion of the smartphones that we all use daily. Is this a good deal for the UK or just another highly leveraged sell off of a great company.

attributes.action: Extend basic rate gift aid to all donations made by private individuals.
attributes.background: Gift aid is allowable on donations by UK taxpayers. Donations made by non taxpayers, which are often a larger proportion of their income should be encouraged by the government. This small gesture would do so at little cost to the exchequer.

attributes.action: Condemn dismissal of judges by Turkish authorities following military coup
attributes.background: Turkish authorities have reacted to the military coup by dismissing nearly 3000 judges around the country. This is a clear victimisation of members of the legal profession and is a disproportionate measure which will impact on administration of justice.

attributes.action: Care homes all fitted with cameras
attributes.background: If pubs need cameras to prevent violence, then why haven't care homes got them? Nothing to hide? Then fit cameras in all care homes now, ideally connected to wifi so that relatives can look in at any time. Obviously beds and bathrooms need to be exempt but accessible by audio.
attributes.additional_details:
A camera with sound in every home where carers visit would also be a good idea, linked via Wi - Fi to anyone requiring access. Nothing to hide? Then nothing to worry about. 
 With an average of £1000 a week the cameras will not event make a dent in profits. 
Sign up now...You may be the next one to be treated badly in care.

attributes.action: Allow first time home buyers to pay stamp duty in installments.
attributes.background: Stamp duty for first time buyers makes buying a new home prohibitive for many. The government should allow first time buyers to pay it installments, rather than having to pay it up front.
attributes.additional_details: Buying a new home is extremely difficult due to the enormous up front cost of the deposit. Even with the governmental schemes to help prospective new home owners stamp duty still poses a major hurdle to every first time home buyer. Allow them to pay it in installments.

attributes.action: Hygiene Facilities in Educational Institutes for our Children
attributes.background: As a grandmother, I struggle at times as my grandchild comes home with her underwear unclean and parents and carers like me would like our children coming home clean and it would be easier for measures to put in place for hygiene purposes.

attributes.action: Redistribute 8 Billion saving from EU to areas with the highest unemployment.
attributes.background: If, we are to leave the EU, and the amount saved is 8 billion pounds. This money should not be swallowed up by tax cuts. It should go to alleviating poverty, in the areas that need it most.

attributes.action: Any decision which may lead to significant changes must be agreed by parliament.
attributes.background: Recently we have heard a lot of differing opinions on the actioning of article 50 of the EU charter. This petition is so that any major changes to the UK must be debated in the Commons & agreed to by parliamentary vote.
attributes.additional_details:
Recently we have heard a lot of differing opinions on the actioning of article 50 of the EU charter. 
As we know there was a referendum with a narrow margin in favour of leaving the EU. However given the imperfection information provided by both campaign the final decision should be debated by the Commons and voted on by this elected parliament to ensure the best outcome for all. Any major decisions regarding the future of the United Kingdom made in the UK should be debated and agreed upon by parliament who hold sovereignty. Any executive power held by the Prime Minister derived from the crown should be held to a minimum.

attributes.action: Parliament make a full and unequivocal apology for UK's part in invading Iraq
attributes.background: There is a case for parliament to make a full unequivocal apology for going to war with USA on Iraqi, killing so many of their people and our soldiers following the outcome of Chilcot Inquiry. Be sceptical about Trident submarine replacement and other military things USA may try to pull UK into.
attributes.additional_details:
USA simply went to war with an aim of "bomb back to the stone age" countries with things they wanted. Senior US spokes persons have admitted that the motive for invasion was because Saddam was seeking to raise the price of oil. Parliament used a lie to disguise its reasons. It is time to be somewhat sceptical about what USA expects of UK. 

Now is time to apologies.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to conduct racially insulting political campaign
attributes.background: It has become very common for politicians running for offices and campaigns lying and run racially insulting campaigns. Request the parliament to make it illegal to run such campaigns filled with lies and racial hatred
attributes.additional_details: The European Union referendum and the following Leaders elections have become very dirty. Many times the opponents blaming wrongly each other supporting certain religions. Using religion hatred is illegal in UK already, but no one is questioning the politicians when they are inciting the racial hatred. Request the parliamentarians to discuss this in the parliament and make laws to make racially motivated smear campaigns as illegal.

attributes.action: Make all forms of non-medical genital mutilation of minors illegal
attributes.background: Any genital mutilation (GM) of boys and girls, even if they supposedly give consent, should be made illegal.
attributes.additional_details: GM for religious reasons is particularly heinous as it permanently marks the child as a member of a religion into which no child can be born only inculcated.

attributes.action: STOP the closure of another A&E department in the North East...
attributes.background: Proposals would see A&E departments across Teesside, Durham and Darlington reduced from four to three; putting additional pressure on existing services.  Contradicting the Government’s pledge to ‘improve the health of the country’ and 'making services easier for patients to access'.
attributes.additional_details: The loss of local A&E Services in Hartlepool in 2011, has already caused unnecessary hardship and inconvenience for patients who now travel to Stockton to access A&E.  The road infrastructure (A19 / A66) is inadequate; causing delays for ambulances and patients, potentially causing unnecessary deaths.  The remaining four A&E Departments serve Hartlepool, Stockton, Middlesbrough, Redcar & Cleveland and Darlington, with a total population of 662,800 (2011 Census).

attributes.action: Accept & publish on website all Petitions associated with UK EU referendum
attributes.background:
Little debate in parliament regarding all the implications of the UK leaving EU prior 23 June 2016 Referendum

UK petition website should accept all submitted petitions regardless of whether assessor assumes similar to another petition. Exiting EU is highly complex all petitions require debate.
attributes.additional_details:
Citizens should have been aware of positives & negatives of UK leaving EU prior voting

Petition assessor rejected "Agree in leaving the EU, negotiate continued Free Movement for All UK citizens."
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/157571
Petition rejected grounds claiming similar to another petition  https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/135700

All EU referendum petitions need open debate. Simply rejecting petitions on assumption similar when issues highly complex is undemocratic.

attributes.action: Improve young voter turnout: polling stations in universities and colleges
attributes.background: Young voters are statistically proven to have a poorer turnout to elections than older voters, despite having to live longer with the results. In order to improve young voter turnout, improving accessibility to polling stations by putting them in educational institutions ought to be considered.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.economist.com/blogs/economist-explains/2014/10/economist-explains-24

https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2016/jun/28/young-people-bad-voting-millennials-eu-vote-politics

https://next.ft.com/content/1ce1a720-ce94-3c32-a689-8d2356388a1f

attributes.action: Call a general election or allow a vote on repealing the Communities Act 1972.
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to either call a general election or ensure that there is a vote in parliament for repealing the European Communities Act 1972 before invoking Article 50.
attributes.additional_details:
We feel that you owe the electorate and/or Parliament a choice given that :-

Scotland, Northern Ireland, Gibraltar, London and 75% of MPs all voted to remain.

The UK Leave majority was slim, so there is not a strong mandate to leave.

There is currently no leadership in either of the main parties.

There is a constitutional crisis which threatens the breakup of two Unions.

That the defacto leader of the Leave campaign will not stand as PM.

attributes.action: Review how MPs are elected, can exercise power & standards they must adhere to.
attributes.background:
We seek government through consensus, with resources used to achieve our priorities: 
Access to healthcare & education based on need, not ability to pay.
Mental and physical health have equal status
Economic profitability is only a tool to facilitate the achievement of these priorities.
attributes.additional_details:
MPs shall: 
-live and work in the constituency they represent
-use publicly available local education and health services.
-not receive any direct or indirect financial benefit other than their salary as an MP.
-not hold any office in any organisation during their tenure as MP, whether voluntary or paid.
-MPs income from investments, business or other interests shall be accumulated in a zero interest account. 
-not exercise any voting rights or other powers they may have over such funds.

attributes.action: Establish support mechanisms to aid people experiencing abuse due to Brexit.
attributes.background: This petition asks Parliament to urgently recommend putting in place visible resources (web, social & phone) so that members of the public who have been subject to abuse related to Brexit know where to turn to seek advice and the support of concerned and loving members of their community.
attributes.additional_details: Reports of members of the public being subjected to racial or xenophobic abuse has increased noticeably since Brexit. Mechanisms exist to report such hate crimes to the police but there is little visible information connecting the victim or scared member o/t public to volunteer groups representing caring individuals in the community or for those who wish to help, to join together. This issue needs a national voice and to be seen as the responsibility of all ordinary decent civilians.

attributes.action: Make the drink driving law more strict or introduce a zero tolerance policy.
attributes.background:
Every year, over 250 people are killed on UK roads and over 7,000 casualties from drink driving. In 2013, 683,651 roadside breath tests were carried out by the police, which 71,675 drivers
or riders failed or refused to take the test. Many of these are due to people driving the morning after.
attributes.additional_details: We, the undersigned suggest that people refer to the horrific facts shown in the RoSPA July 2015 "Drinking and Driving" report to see that even just 1 accident, injury or even death is too many. A reform of the law should be considered to lower the limit or introduce a zero tolerance on the matter. Thus to save the lives of countless people horrifically torn away from their families in such awful circumstances.

attributes.action: We will not tolerate public acts of discrimination
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Govt. to increase punitive measures in response to public acts of aggressive, racial and xenophobic discrimination by 50% for a period of 1 year following the EU Referendum. We believe this will send the clear message that the People of Britain do not tolerate racism.
attributes.additional_details: In the wake of the EU referendum, the risk that racism and bigotry will show itself as an accepted part of our society is higher than ever. By signing this petition, you are calling on our Government to take official steps to show that we are not a racist, bigoted nation and will punish those who seek to do harm to another person because of their culture, religion, country of origin or ethnicity and those who seek to alienate  people along these lines during this political upheaval.

attributes.action: Create a clear legal framework for UK-wide referenda
attributes.background:
The EU Referendum highlighted the problems of using this democratic tool in the U.K,: a small majority, rejection by two home nations, and purely advisory in nature.
This vagueness, uncertainty, and unfairness is plainly unsatisfactory and must be addressed before any future referenda are held.
attributes.additional_details:
It is proposed that a referendum shall be binding on the Government if either of the following criteria is met:
- The votes for the winning side total at least 50% of the total number of those eligible to vote plus one, or
- The winning side is supported by simple majorities in at least three of the four home nations, and by at least two-thirds of the total votes cast.
In all other cases, the Government shall be required to take note of the result of the referendum, but is not bound by it.

attributes.action: The Government to establish the workings of Article 50 TEU before invocation.
attributes.background: Article 50 of the EU describes the method of how a country leaves the EU. There is insufficient information within the text of the article to properly understand how the mechanics of it would work. The government should seek answers to all outstanding questions prior to invocation.
attributes.additional_details: The biggest outstanding questions is whether or not an article 50 invocation can be withdrawn or not. Others are around the scope of what can be negotiated and what needs to be agreed before the conclusion of article 50. The Government should establish all outstanding questions from the public and seek answers from the EU before article 50 is ever invoked.

attributes.action: Britain should apply to become the 51st state of the United States of America
attributes.background: In light of the result of the EU Referendum held on Thursday 23 June and the immediate concomitant decline in the UK economy, it would be germain to enter into a stronger economic union with the United States of America at the earliest possible opportunity.
attributes.additional_details: Under Article IV, Section 3, of the US Constitution, any territory may apply to Congress to join the United States. As the 51st US state, Great Britain would gain all the economic and military backing of the US federal government whilst also being free to draft its own state constitution and effectively retain its sovereignty. This would have the added advantage of allowing the UK Government to invoke Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty sooner than October in order to re-stabilise the EU economy.

attributes.action: Make Imperial Units legal for trade and mandatory alongside Metric Units.
attributes.background: Due to a change in Britain's EU status, make it legal to trade in Imperial Units again and also mandatory to have Imperial Units alongside any existing Metric Units.
attributes.additional_details: A lot of the British public would still prefer to use Imperial Units (Oz, Lbs, Inch, Foot, °F) but European Parliament made it illegal to trade in Imperial Units back in 2000. Due to a change in Great Britain's status in the EU many people would like the right to trade in Imperial Units and also have food packaging etc labelled in duel Units (Metric and Imperial) this is in the interests of everybody as many like to use Metric and many like to use Imperial

attributes.action: Post Brexit UK must apologise for Biafran War.
attributes.background: When the state of Biafra tried to secede from Nigeria in 1967 to prevent the genocide of it's people, the UK supplied arms to the Nigerian Army which caused deaths of millions of innocent Biafrans, mostly through starvation. Biafrans have the same right as Britons to decide their own future.
attributes.additional_details:
In 1967, the leaders of Nigeria agreed to partition their own country into states that would reflect the ethnic origins of it's own people. However, UK, the former colonial ruler demanded that Nigeria must remain as one country. This cruel policy led directly to the blockading of Biafra and cause the deaths of millions of innocent people. 
Please watch 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5fMehSE6kp4
and read
